This file contains a fair amount
of text. It's
on
multiple
lines, just to see what happens
if you read a file
with text
on multiple lines in C.

I guess it works?

So, there's a lot of text still needed to make this a lot of text. Without a lot of text,
there's no point to an example that reads a lot of text. It should be obvious
that this example is not long enough yet. I mean, if the buffer is 1000 characters long, we
aren't even making it resize once yet! What a joke!

So what can we do? How about making some long gibberish lines!

Like this:

          111111111122222222223333333333444444444455555555556666666666777777777788888888899999999999
0123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789

          111111111122222222223333333333444444444455555555556666666666777777777788888888899999999999
0123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789

          111111111122222222223333333333444444444455555555556666666666777777777788888888899999999999
0123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789

          111111111122222222223333333333444444444455555555556666666666777777777788888888899999999999
0123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789

          111111111122222222223333333333444444444455555555556666666666777777777788888888899999999999
0123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789

0123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789

0123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789

That's better! That's over 2000 characters, yeah!!
